isis.stitle: TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR - ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT OPERATION - CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS

svcprocinfo.para: Circuit diagrams can be found in GROUP 08-ELECTRICAL of the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Circuit diagrams ( Figure 2) provide a schematic picture of how a circuit is powered, what the current path is to circuit components, and how the circuit is grounded.

In most cases, the power source will appear at the top of the page, and the ground will be at the bottom of the page (or bottom of circuit). The circuit components are named, using capital letters. Abbreviations may be used ( Figure 4).

important.para: Switch, relay and solenoid positions, as shown on circuit diagrams, indicate NORMAL position with the key switch in the OFF position, unless otherwise noted.

svcprocinfo.para: Components which work together are shown together. All electrical components used in any circuit are shown in the circuit diagram. The power source (fuse, circuit breaker, junction point, etc.) is usually shown or indicated at the top of the page. All wires, connectors, and other electrical components are shown in the signal flow to the bottom of the page (or bottom of the circuit).
